meanings.definition: A person who goes without something.
meanings.sent1: The forgoer decided to skip dessert to save money.
meanings.sent2: The forgoer lived a minimalist lifestyle, avoiding unnecessary luxuries.
meanings.sent3: The forgoer at the party only drank water, much to the surprise of others.
meanings.sent4: She was a forgoer of material possessions, finding joy in experiences instead.
meanings.sent5: The forgoer's self-discipline in forgoing temptations was admirable.

meanings.sent1: I had to forgo my morning coffee to catch the early bus.
meanings.sent2: She had to forgo her dream vacation to save up for a new car.
meanings.sent3: He decided to forgo sleep to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent4: The athlete had to forgo his favorite foods to maintain a strict diet.
meanings.sent5: The decision to forgo immediate gratification led to long-term success.
